definition: to rejoice in grandiose deeds/to strive to achieve extraordinary things
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: Like the Li Shiwu eyeing gold deep water.
sentences.chinese: 好大喜功的李士武盯上了金深水。

sentences.english: Texans have a tradition of doing things in a big way.
sentences.chinese: 好大喜功是德州人做事的傳統。

sentences.english: The general always craves for greatness and success.
sentences.chinese: 那個將軍總是好大喜功。

definition: to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
